current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To secure the Federal voting rights of non-violent persons when released from incarceration.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

quote.#tail:

The right of an
			 individual who is a citizen of the United States to vote in any election
			 for
			 Federal office shall not be denied or abridged because the individual has
			 been
			 convicted of a non-violent criminal offense, unless, at the time of the
			 election, the individual—

is
			 serving a sentence in a correctional institution or facility; or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is serving a term of probation.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Civil Rights Voting Restoration Act of 2014/s:3/ss:b

text.#text: subject to

An individual who is serving a term of probation shall have the right to vote restored in any
			 election for Federal office—

header.#text: Restoration of voting rights for individuals on probation

text.#text: on the date on which the term of probation ends, if the term of probation is less than 1 year; or

on the date that is 1 year after the date on which the individual begins serving the term of
			 probation, if the term of probation is 1 year or longer.

This section shall take effect 1 year after the date of
			 enactment of this Act.

shall

			 offenses under Federal law and the laws of each State are non-violent
			 criminal offenses
			 and establish a list of all such offenses.

Nothing in this Act shall be construed
			 to prohibit the States from enacting any State law which affords the right
			 to
			 vote in any election for Federal office on terms less restrictive than
			 those
			 established by this Act.

header.#text:
State laws
			 relating to voting rights

text.#text: The rights and remedies established by this Act—

are in
			 addition to all other rights and remedies provided by law; and

shall not supersede, restrict, or limit
			 the
			 application of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Voting Rights Act of 1965
usc/42/1973/etseq
National Voter Registration Act

text.#text:
Nothing in this Act shall be construed to preempt State laws relating to the timing of voter
			 registration for any election for Federal office.

header.#text: State laws relating to voter registration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Civil Rights Voting Restoration Act of 2014/s:3

text.#text:
No State, unit of local
			 government, or other person may receive or use, to construct or otherwise
			 improve a prison, jail, or other place of incarceration, any Federal grant
			 amounts unless that person has in effect a program under which each
			 individual
			 incarcerated in that person’s jurisdiction is notified, upon release from
			 such incarceration, of that
			 individual’s
			 rights under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Civil Rights Voting Restoration Act of 2014/s:6/ss:a

text.#text:
No State may receive or use, to construct or otherwise improve a prison, jail, or other place of
			 incarceration, any Federal grant amounts unless the State is in compliance
			 with the notification requirements under
